Course Description: This is a senior UG / PG level course on Compressed Sensing. Compressed Sensing (CS) is most talked about topic in signal processing today and is taught in all the top universities across the world. CS is the study of under-determined linear inverse problems where the solution is typically a lower dimensional many fold embedded in a higher dimensional space. The most prominent examples being - a sparse solution or a low-rank solution. Today compressed sensing permeates not only signal processing and applied maths but also encompasses a variety of topics in machine learning and computer vision. This course is open to both CS and ECE students.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to model physical problems (related to CS).
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to implement CS algorithms in applications.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are able to understand and present current research papers published in top-tier journals and conferences.
Course Outcomes.CO5: Students are able to advanced project work in this area.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Some Fundamentals of Functional Analysis & Linear Inverse Problems
Compressed Sensing: Theory & Workshop on Linear Algebra Tools
Low-rank Matrix Recovery - Theory and Applications
Low-rank Matrix Recovery - Algorithms (factorization and completion)
Dictionary Learning Algorithms & Applications in inverse problems

Resource Material.Title: Sparse and redundant representation - Michael Elad
